title: Sheep in the Shed
text: The sheep run to the shed. The shed is warm and dry. The big sheep and the small sheep stay in the shed at night.

title: Shut the Shed
text: Dad will shut the shed door. The sheep are safe. The wind will not get in when the shed is shut tight.

title: Sheep Shop
text: The sheep go to the farm shop. They see wool, milk, and jam. The shop is small, but it is fun to see.

title: Ship on the Pond
text: The duck sees a toy ship on the pond. It bobs and dips. The duck quacks and swims fast to the ship.

title: Shy Sheep
text: A shy sheep hides by the shed. The pig and hen call it out to play. The sheep runs and has fun at last.

title: Duck in the Muck
text: The duck sits in the muck by the pond. It flaps its wings and makes a big splash. The chick laughs and joins in.

title: Little Chick
text: A little chick pecks the sack. The sack is full of corn. The chick eats and hops back to the hen.

title: Clock in the Shed
text: A clock ticks in the shed. The sheep hear it and nod. Tick tock, tick tock, says the clock by the sack.

title: Duck Back Home
text: The duck comes back from the pond. The chicks peep and run to see. The farm is calm as the sun sets.

title: Pack the Sack
text: Mum packs the sack with corn for the hens. The chick pecks at a seed and clucks. The farm is busy today.

title: Pig in the Mud
text: The pig rolls in the mud. The sun is hot. The pig is cool now and happy in the wet mud pit.

title: Goat on the Hill
text: The goat stands high on the hill. It can see the shed, the pond, and the cows. It bleats and jumps down.

title: Cow and Hen
text: The cow moos and the hen clucks. They wait by the gate for food. The sun shines on the farm today.

title: A Busy Farm Day
text: The hens peck and cluck. The ducks swim. The sheep rest in the shed. The farm is full of sound and fun.

title: Night on the Farm
text: The sun goes down. The chicks sleep in the shed. The sheep are still. The farm is quiet and dark now.

title: The Busy Bee
text: A bee buzzes by the tree. It lands on a red rose. The bee likes to sip sweet food from each flower it can see.

title: The Green Tree
text: The green tree stands tall. A bird sits on its top branch. The bee hums near the leaves and the flowers shine below.

title: Plant a Seed
text: Mum helps me plant a seed. We dig a hole in the soil. The seed will grow and we will see a green shoot soon.

title: Bee and Ant
text: A bee meets an ant by the tree. They look for food. The ant finds crumbs, and the bee flies to the red rose.

title: See the Bee
text: I see a bee near the green leaf. It hums and flies fast. The bee stops to sip from the pink flower by the tree.

title: Under the Moon
text: The moon is bright. The snails slide slow on the path. A frog hops near the pond. The night garden is cool and calm.

title: Roots in the Soil
text: The roots hold the plant in the soil. Worms wiggle near the roots. The rain helps the soil stay soft and cool.

title: Boots On!
text: I put my boots on to go in the garden. The grass is wet and the soil is soft. My boots make deep marks in the mud.

title: Food for the Bug
text: A bug eats a bit of leaf. The bee finds food too. The garden is full of tiny bugs that eat and crawl all day.

title: Room for the Root
text: The root needs room to grow. The soil is soft and brown. The seed will push down deep and soon we will see a sprout.

title: Little Slug
text: A little slug slides on a leaf. It hides from the sun. When the moon comes up, the slug moves to eat fresh plants.

title: Weeds and Seeds
text: We pull up the weeds to make space. Then we plant seeds in rows. Soon the green shoots grow and bees buzz by them.

title: Frog in the Pool
text: The frog sits in the cool pool. It sees a moon in the water. A bee flies by and the frog makes a splash!

title: Tree and Leaf
text: A green leaf falls from the tree. It lands on soft soil. A worm crawls under it, and the bee hums near a flower.

title: Night in the Garden
text: The moon glows on the garden. The trees are still. A slug creeps on the soil and a bat swoops low in the cool air.

title: Sail the Boat
text: We sail a small boat on the sea. The wind blows the sail high. The waves move the boat fast and we smile wide.

title: Pail of Sand
text: I fill my pail with soft sand. I pat it flat and lift the pail up. It makes a tall sand hill in the sun.

title: Rain and Shells
text: Rain falls on the beach. We run to the hut with our shells. The rain stops soon and the sea shines bright again.

title: Train to the Sea
text: We take a train to the beach. The sea is blue and wide. We play with our pail and make big sand cakes all day.

title: Paint the Shell
text: I paint a shell red and blue. Mum paints one green. We line them up by the sand wall and make a shell train.

title: With the Crab
text: I see the crab in the wet sand. It moves fast with tiny claws. I look at it and then it hides under a rock.

title: This Big Wave
text: The sea makes a big wave. I jump with the splash. Mum laughs as the wave hits our feet. We run back to the sand.

title: That Fish
text: I see that fish swim by. It is small and quick. The fish glints in the sun as it darts through the blue water.

title: Them on the Rock
text: Dad points at the seals. We see them rest on the big rock. They clap and bark. The sea splashes at their tails.

title: With My Spade
text: I dig with my spade in the sand. I find a shell and a crab claw. I show Mum and she smiles and takes a photo.

title: Sea and Rain
text: Rain drops on the sea. The waves splash with sound. I hold my pail and dance in the rain until the sun comes out.

title: With the Shell
text: Dad picks up a shell. I hold it to my ear. I can hear the sea. We smile and play with the shells all day long.

title: Sail in the Sun
text: The boat sails on calm water. The sun shines bright. We watch the sail flap and the gulls glide in the blue sky.

title: This is Fun
text: This is fun! We splash in the waves and run on the wet sand. The sea is cool and the sun is warm on our skin.

title: Train Home
text: We pack our pail and shells. The rain starts again. We take the train back home. I dream of the sea and sun all night.

title: Lunch Time
text: It is lunch time. I have a chip and some cheese. Mum chops an apple too. We sit and munch together in the sun.

title: Big Chips
text: Dad makes big chips for tea. We eat them with peas and corn. I munch and smile. Chips are so tasty and hot!

title: Chop the Carrots
text: Mum chops carrots for soup. I help her mix and stir. The smell is so nice. We eat soup with bread and cheese.

title: Munch and Crunch
text: I munch a red apple. It is crisp and sweet. Dad munches a pear. We crunch and laugh as juice drips down our chins.

title: Cheese Snack
text: We pack cheese cubes and grapes for a snack. At lunch, I eat them with my friends. We all munch and chat happily.

title: Toast for Breakfast
text: I make toast with jam. The toast pops up hot and brown. I spread butter and jam on top. It smells so good to eat!

title: Goat and Oats
text: A goat eats oats by the barn. It chews and chews all day. I feed it more oats and it nods at me. What fun!

title: Soap and Plates
text: After lunch, I wash plates with soap. The bubbles shine. Mum dries the cups. We sing and splash as we clean up.

title: Coat and Loaf
text: I put on my coat to buy bread. The loaf is warm in my bag. I can’t wait to make toast when I get back home.

title: Boat Picnic
text: We sit on a boat and eat lunch. We have toast, fruit, and juice. The waves rock the boat as we munch and smile.

title: Fresh Apple
text: I pick a red apple from the tree. It smells sweet. I take a bite and crunch it loud. It is the best snack ever!

title: Green Peas
text: We pick green peas from the pod. I like to eat them fresh. Mum cooks them with carrots and beans for tea.

title: Bowl of Soup
text: I sit with my bowl of soup. The steam smells good. I blow on the spoon and take a sip. It warms me up inside.

title: Lunch with Dad
text: I eat lunch with Dad. We have chips and toast. He tells a joke and we laugh. I munch and sip my juice happily.

title: Toast and Tea
text: Mum and I have toast and tea. I dip my toast in the tea. We sit by the fire in our coats and chat quietly.

title: First Snow
text: Snow starts to fall. The ground turns white. I blow on my cold hands. Mum says we can make a snowman soon.

title: The Wind Will Blow
text: The wind will blow hard today. My hat flies off! I chase it down the path. The trees sway and leaves spin round.

title: Snow Show
text: Snowflakes fall from the sky. They land soft and light. I show Mum my glove full of snow. We laugh and clap.

title: Slow Sunrise
text: The sun rises slow after the storm. The sky glows pink. I see light on the wet grass. The day will be warm.

title: Plants Grow
text: Rain helps plants grow. I water my pot. A small leaf pops out. Soon I will see a tall green flower in the sun.

title: Dark Clouds
text: Dark clouds roll in fast. The sky turns grey. We run to the car as big drops fall. The rain starts to pour down.

title: Start of Rain
text: I feel a drop on my arm. The rain will start soon. Mum says to grab the coat. We run before it gets too wet!

title: Park in the Sun
text: The park is bright and warm. I swing high and see the blue sky. Dad sits on a bench and smiles as I play.

title: Farm in the Rain
text: The farm is muddy and wet. Pigs roll in the soft dirt. The rain falls on cows and sheep. The farmer waves at me.

title: Car in the Storm
text: We sit in the car and wait. The storm bangs loud on the roof. Mum hums a song. Soon the rain will stop and we go home.

title: A Warm Day
text: The sun is out and it is warm. I play in the park with my kite. The wind blows and the tail spins in the air.

title: Dark Night
text: It is a dark night. Stars twinkle in the sky. I sit by the window and watch the moon glow over the quiet park.

title: Snowy Park
text: Snow falls on the park. I wear my warm coat and boots. We make a snowball and roll it down the hill so fast!

title: Start of Spring
text: The sun is bright and flowers grow. I see bees buzz in the garden. The cold days are gone. I like this start of spring.

title: Wind Show
text: The wind blows hard. Trees bend and sway. We hold our hats tight. The clouds move fast to show a blue sky again.

title: A Fun Toy
text: I have a new toy. It can spin fast. I play with it all day. It brings me so much joy to see it roll and glow.

title: The Boy and His Toy
text: The boy plays with his toy car. It zooms fast on the floor. He laughs and claps. Mum smiles as he enjoys his play.

title: Joy in Play
text: We play with all our toys. The dolls talk and the cars race. We laugh with joy and make up a fun story together.

title: Enjoy the Game
text: I enjoy the game with my friends. We roll the ball and cheer. We take turns to win. It is such a happy day!

title: Roy’s Toy Train
text: Roy has a red toy train. It goes choo choo down the track. He enjoys making it go round and round the rug.

title: Ball Game
text: We play a ball game in the park. I throw it and you catch. The ball rolls away, and we both run to get it back!

title: Small Doll
text: My small doll wears a pink hat. She sits on my bed. I brush her hair and call her Meg. She is my best toy!

title: Fall Down
text: The ball hits the wall and I fall down. I laugh and stand up fast. We play again and roll the ball to each other.

title: Call for Help
text: My toy car is stuck under the bed. I call Dad for help. He lifts the bed up. I grab the car and smile wide.

title: Wall of Blocks
text: I build a wall with blocks. It is tall and wide. Then I roll my ball and knock it down. We laugh so loud!

title: Play the Drum
text: I play my toy drum and tap to the beat. Mum claps along. The sound fills the room. It makes me so happy!

title: Fun in the Park
text: We take the ball to the park. I roll it down the hill. The boy runs fast to catch it. We laugh and play again.

title: Enjoy the Kite
text: I fly my kite high in the sky. The wind pulls and it soars. I enjoy the bright tail that waves as clouds go by.

title: Small Box
text: My toys fit in a small box. I keep them neat. I open it each day to play. The box is full of fun and joy.

title: Boy in the Room
text: The boy plays with his ball and car. He rolls them on the mat. Mum calls him for tea. He grins and runs to eat!

title: The Morning Bell
text: The bell rings for school. We line up at the door. The teacher smiles and says good morning. We go to our class.

title: Meet the Teacher
text: Our teacher is kind and fun. She helps us read a new book. We write a letter on paper and draw a big red apple.

title: Story Time
text: We sit on the floor for story time. The story is short but sweet. The teacher reads and we all listen quietly.

title: Write a Letter
text: I write a letter to Mum. I use paper and a pencil. The teacher helps me spell each word. I draw hearts on top.

title: Maths is Fun
text: We count blocks on the desk. The teacher shows us more. We add and take away. Maths can be fun when we learn together.

title: Break Time
text: The bell rings for break. We run to the yard. The boys play ball and the girls skip rope. It is bright and warm.

title: Art Class
text: We paint in art class. My paper is full of red and blue. The teacher hangs our work on the wall for all to see.

title: A Short Song
text: We sing a short song in music. The tune is soft and slow. I clap my hands and tap my feet. It makes me smile.

title: Paper Chain
text: We cut paper to make a chain. Each link is bright and long. The teacher helps us hang it up across the board.

title: Morning Work
text: In the morning we write on the board. The teacher shows us new words. We read them out loud and clap the sounds.

title: Science Time
text: We mix water and sand in science. It feels soft and wet. The teacher says we can pour it slow to see what happens.

title: Clean the Corner
text: We clean the art corner before lunch. I pick up paper and put pens away. The teacher says thank you for helping out.

title: Floor Game
text: We sit on the floor to play a word game. The teacher says a sound. We clap when we hear it in a short word.

title: Letter Home
text: I get a letter for Mum. It says I did well in class. The teacher smiles as I read it out. I feel so proud.

title: End of the Day
text: The bell rings for home. We pack up our books and bags. The teacher waves goodbye. I smile and walk with my friends.

title: Monster Night Party
text: The monsters dance at night. They spin under the bright light. Their eyes shine high in the sky. It is such a funny sight!

title: High Jump
text: A tall monster can jump so high. He leaps over the wall and waves his tail. His claws flash in the light as he lands softly.

title: Bright Smiles
text: The monsters smile bright and wide. Their teeth shine in the moonlight. They giggle and roar and play tag all night long!

title: A Night Roar
text: It is a dark night. A big blue monster lets out a roar. The noise is loud but not scary. It makes the trees shake!

title: A Funny Sight
text: I see a monster with four eyes and a green hat. He waves at me from the bright street light. I laugh so hard I fall down!

title: Purple Fur
text: The little monster has purple fur. It looks soft and warm. She curls up on a rug and hums a silly tune before bed.

title: The Burping Game
text: Two monsters play a burping game. They take turns and laugh. The sound makes the birds fly off the trees in a hurry!

title: Fuzzy Fur
text: My monster friend has pink fuzzy fur. It sticks out when she spins. I brush it down but she makes it messy again and giggles.

title: The Purrr Sound
text: The furry monster sits by the fire and makes a purrr sound. It curls up like a cat. I pat its head and it smiles softly.

title: Curl Up
text: When the night is cold, the monsters curl up together. Their purple fur keeps them warm. They snore and dream of more fun!

title: Light Show
text: The monsters make a light show with fireflies. They clap and spin. The bright dots dance in the air like tiny stars in the sky.

title: Monster Party
text: It is party night! The monsters stomp and dance. One burps and one jumps high. The lights flash bright and everyone cheers loud!

title: Night Song
text: At night, the monsters sing a song. Their voices hum in the dark. The stars glow bright and the moon smiles down on them.

title: Paint It Purple
text: The monsters paint their cave purple. The walls sparkle in the light. They get paint on their fur and laugh until they fall down!

title: Silly Dance
text: The monsters do a silly dance under the moonlight. They spin, roar, and hop on one foot. Their shadows jump high on the walls!

title: My Town
text: I live in a small town. It has a park, a shop, and a school. We walk down the road to see friends and buy some bread.

title: Go Downhill
text: I ride my bike down the hill to the park. The wind blows on my face. I stop to see ducks in the pond near the gate.

title: The Town Clown
text: A clown comes to our town fair. He has a big red nose and a funny hat. We laugh when he falls down in a big brown puddle!

title: The Crown Shop
text: In the toy shop, I see a crown. It is gold and shiny. I try it on and feel like a king. Mum says it looks great on me!

title: The Brown Bus
text: A big brown bus goes by my house. It stops by the shop to pick up people. I wave to the driver and he waves back to me.

title: First Stop
text: The bus stops first at the post office. The driver smiles. A girl gets on with her dad. She wears a pink shirt and a big grin.

title: Bird in the Park
text: A bird sings in the park tree. I sit on the bench and listen. It makes a soft sound that fills the warm morning air.

title: Girl and Bike
text: A girl rides her bike to school. She wears a red shirt and a big smile. The bell rings as she parks it near the gate.

title: Third Floor
text: I visit the library on the third floor. There are books on every shelf. I find a story about a bird that can talk and sing!

title: Shirt from the Shop
text: Dad buys me a new shirt from the shop. It is blue with stars. I wear it to school and my friends say it looks so cool!

title: Town Train
text: The train comes to our town. It is long and loud. We sit by the window and watch as trees and houses go by so fast!

title: Market Day
text: It is market day in town. People sell fruit, bread, and toys. I help Mum carry a bag. We walk down the street in the sun.

title: My First Train Ride
text: It is my first time on the train. I sit by the window with Dad. We watch cows in fields and birds in the sky fly by fast.

title: Down to School
text: We walk down the road to school. I see cars and bikes go by. The bell rings when we get there. The day can start now!

title: Bird and Clown
text: At the fair, a clown tosses his hat. A bird lands on it! Everyone laughs as they spin and dance around the big brown tent.

title: A Quiet Night
text: It was a quiet night. The stars shone bright in the sky. A small bear curled up to sleep under the big silver moon.

title: The Quick Dragon
text: A quick dragon flew past the moon. Its wings flapped fast. It looked for the castle where the kind queen was waiting to sleep.

title: The Queen’s Crown
text: The queen had a gold crown. She placed it on her bed stand. ‘Good night,’ she said softly, and the lights went out quick and quiet.

title: The Quiet Castle
text: The castle was quiet at night. The king and queen were asleep. Only the moonlight filled the hall and made it shine like silver snow.

title: The Quack Song
text: Down by the pond, the ducks sang their quack song. They splashed and danced under the stars. It was time for bed after a long day.

title: The King’s Song
text: The king sat by the fire. He began to sing a soft song. The sound filled the room, and the guards smiled as they went to rest.

title: The Fairy Ring
text: Tiny fairies danced in a ring. They sang a happy tune. The moon glowed above them as they spun round and round in the grass.

title: The Long Sleep
text: The dragon yawned and lay down. It had been a long day. It closed its eyes and dreamed of flying high over mountains and stars.

title: Sing to the Moon
text: A girl sat by her window. She began to sing to the moon. The night wind hummed along, and her soft voice filled the dark sky.

title: The Magic Ring
text: A wizard found a magic ring. When he put it on, stars began to sing! He smiled and said, ‘This will make a fine bedtime tale.’

title: Princess Song
text: The princess sang a song for her doll. Her voice was soft and sweet. The king smiled as he said, ‘Good night, my lovely girl.’

title: A Quiet Story
text: Mum read a quiet story by the bed. The lights were dim, and the room was warm. Soon, I was asleep and dreaming of kings and queens.

title: The Night Song
text: The stars twinkled bright. The moon sang a gentle tune. The long night passed as children dreamed of dragons, fairies, and happy kings.

title: The Queen and the King
text: The queen and the king sat by the fire. They told a story about a songbird that could sing all night long without resting once.

title: Quick to Sleep
text: The bear brushed his fur and got into bed. He was quick to sleep after his long walk. The stars shone as he began to dream.
